benchmark_details.name: RegMiner4APR
benchmark_details.overview: We introduce RegMiner4APR, a high-quality Java regression error benchmark integrated into a framework designed to facilitate APR research, including 99 confirmed regression bugs from 32 distinct real-world Java repositories.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate empirical studies of automated program repair (APR) techniques on regression bugs and provide a high-quality benchmark for future research.

data.source: 99 regression bugs collected from 32 widely used real-world Java GitHub repositories.
data.annotation: Automated validation with filtering criteria to identify true regression bugs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the number of plausible patches and correct patches generated by APR techniques.
methodology.interpretation: A higher number of correct patches indicates better performance of the automated program repair tools.
methodology.validation: Each regression bug is validated through automated checks based on behavioral conditions.
